meanings.definition: The scientific study of celestial objects and phenomena.
meanings.sent1: In astronomy, scientists observe stars and planets to learn more about them.
meanings.sent2: Many universities offer courses in astronomy for students interested in space.
meanings.sent3: The astronomy professor joked that even aliens would find his lectures out of this world!
meanings.sent4: Her passion for astronomy was like a never-ending journey through the vast cosmos.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of astronomy lies in the endless mysteries waiting to be discovered.

meanings.definition: The branch of science that deals with the physical and chemical properties of celestial bodies and with the nature of the universe as a whole.
meanings.sent1: Studying astronomy involves exploring the composition of stars and galaxies.
meanings.sent2: Astronomy helps us understand the vastness and complexity of the universe.
meanings.sent3: The astronomy conference was so full of stars, it felt like a Hollywood red carpet event!
meanings.sent4: His mind was a universe of thoughts, each one a different aspect of astronomy.
meanings.sent5: The wonder of astronomy is that it unveils the secrets of the cosmos one discovery at a time.
